result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. DaKwan J. Selvie

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on December 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:50 PM
Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm. Atty status. Bond continued as previously set. ec
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, DaKwan J. Selvie, appeared.  Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for DaKwan J. Selvie
Current: 1006 42nd Street, Kenosha, WI 53140 United States  (Effective: 08-15-2022)
Prior: 3007 Gilboa Ave, Zion, IL 60099

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Davaion S.

0231 PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Toni Young.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 8/31/22 @845am. $1500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). ec
